M:Autodesk.Revit.UI.Plumbing.PipeFitting.remarks: The Entity that is returned is a copy of the stored data (with copy-on-write optimization). Modifying it is allowed (even with restricted write), but to save your changes you must call SetEntity.

T:Autodesk.Revit.UI.Plumbing.IPipeFittin.title: IPipeFittingAndAccessoryPressureDropUIServer Interface
T:Autodesk.Revit.UI.Plumbing.IPipeFittin.desc: Interface for external servers providing optional UI for pipe fitting and pipe accessory coefficient calculation.
T:Autodesk.Revit.UI.Plumbing.IPipeFittin.remarks: This service works with pipe fitting and accessory pressure drop service. It provides the settings for the pipe fitting and accessory pressure drop server if needed; and it also provides UI for user to input the settings in Revit. A typical way to use the external server can be: Implement a server class that derives from this interface Create a new server object and register it with the service.

T:Autodesk.Revit.UI.Plumbing.PipeFitting.title: PipeFittingAndAccessoryPressureDropUIDataItem Class
T:Autodesk.Revit.UI.Plumbing.PipeFitting.desc: The input and output data used by external UI servers for initializing and storing the UI settings.
T:Autodesk.Revit.UI.Plumbing.PipeFitting.remarks: One family instance has one UI data item. The UI data item contains a corresponding PipeFittingAndAccessoryData which is used for initialing the UI settings and an entity which is used for storing the UI settings.
